title.narrative: MONGOLIA COVID-19 EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND HEALTH SYSTEM PREPAREDNESS PROJECT

description.narrative: The development objective of the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Emergency Response and Health System Preparedness Project for Mongolia is to strengthen Mongolia's capacity to prevent and respond to the COVID-19 outbreak and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness. The project comprises of four components. The first component, emergency COVID-19 prevention and response aim to slow down and limit the spread of COVID-19 in the country and improve preparedness for future public health emergencies. It consists of following sub-components: (i) risk communication and community engagement; (ii) response support; (iii) human resource development; and (iv) creating an enabling environment for one health. The second component, strengthening health care delivery capacity aim to strengthen essential health care service delivery to be able to provide the best care possible in the event of a surge in demand. It consists of following sub-components: (i) provision of medical and laboratory equipment and reagents; and (ii) provision of medical supplies, including personal protective equipment (PPE) and medicines. The third component, implementation management and monitoring and evaluation will support monitoring and evaluation of prevention and preparedness, building capacity for clinical and public health research, and joint-learning across and within countries. The fourth component, contingent emergency response component will contribute to providing immediate and effective response to said crisis or emergency.

title.narrative: Number of hospitals meeting MOH established standards to manage Severe Acute Respiratory Infections (SARI) patients including intensive care
Proportion of laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 responded to within 48 hours
Number of designated laboratories with COVID-19/SARI diagnostic capacities established per MOH guidelines
Samples from suspected cases of COVID-19 / SARI that are confirmed within the stipulated WHO standard time
Number mass media messages disseminated on emerging infectious diseases, six monthly
Number of ventilators provided to hospitals
Independent review of equipment purchase and utilization carried out annually
Proportion of identified contacts who are successfully traced
Percentage of Aimag/district hospitals with pandemic preparedness and response plans per Ministry of Health Guidelines
Six monthly reports prepared and circulated in a timely manner
Number of “One Health”-based simulation exercises conducted and certified by Ministry of Health/ Agriculture at national and sub-national levels
Percentages of provincial and district general hospitals with personal protective equipment and infection control products and supplies, without stock-outs in preceding two weeks
Number of health staff trained in infection prevention and control per MOH-approved protocols
